title: I like how intentional feeders are never punished
body: I've reported them so many times but I've never gotten the notification that they've been dealt with. But, when I do report someone for verbal abuse, I usually get that notification. Plus, those inters often show up in my other games so I know nothing has happened to them. Is riot honestly ok with people inting? In my 5 years of playing league, I've never seen anyone get punished for it.

replies.body:
There are two explainations for what you are experiencing:

1. Inting detection  is currently tuned to the cautious side to prevent accidentally punishing innocent people.

2. You have the incorrect idea of what inting is and are making false reports.

Since you said you reported so many of them, and inting doesnt happen that often, I'm more geared towards you having an incorrect perception of what inting is.

> [{quoted}](name=Kei143,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=k9ZcjFlU,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-07-31T10:58:51.712+0000)
>
> There are two explainations for what you are experiencing:
> 
> 1. Inting detection  is currently tuned to the cautious side to prevent accidentally punishing innocent people.
> 
> 2. You have the incorrect idea of what inting is and are making false reports.
> 
> Since you said you reported so many of them, and inting doesnt happen that often, I'm more geared towards you having an incorrect perception of what inting is.

Here are the actual reasons why, and not some random bullshit: 

1. Riot doesn't care about inters or trolls, they cater to younger people and their parents so they "care" about people who type in chat. If they wanted to actually get rid of inters they woulda came up with something a while ago to better detect it, or would at least punish it the same way they do toxicity. They don't care and they've shown it a million times. And it's unbelievably stupid.

> [{quoted}](name=im still toxic,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=k9ZcjFlU,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-07-31T11:05:49.633+0000)
>
> Here are the actual reasons why, and not some random bullshit: 
> 
> 1. Riot doesn't care about inters or trolls, they cater to younger people and their parents so they "care" about people who type in chat. If they wanted to actually get rid of inters they woulda came up with something a while ago to better detect it, or would at least punish it the same way they do toxicity. They don't care and they've shown it a million times. And it's unbelievably stupid.

Blatant inters are banned almost instantly (in comparison to soft inting anyway). It's the soft inters that's running into issues, especially if the said inter has said nothing in the actual match, which is very hard for the automated system to determine if the person is actually inting or just being very bad at the game. 

You can say that "why not just manually review the match?" The problem is that Riot has hundreds of thousands matches, if not more, played daily. There is no way for any company to finish watching all of the match recordings if they wanna do it manually. Not to mention, even if they do have the man-power to actually keep up with it, a person looking at soft inting is just as confused as an AI would if there is no definite tale-tell signs, that they really don't know if the person is actually inting or just plain bad. 

Either way, statistical behaviour analysis will be necessary in both methods of reviewing either way, and such analysis needs time to build the suspect's profile and then analyse it. It's not very efficient, but what else can one do?

Also, the system is acute enough to at the very least be capable of detecting intentional last-minute throwing. There have been a couple players getting banned without seeming any problem in the human eyes, which the player argued big time for a ban appeal, until a Rioter stepped in and destroyed it by stating that the person actually had a history of intentional and subtle throwing at the last minute of a match. So it's not like Riot doesn't try, just that soft inting can get extremely hard to identify, as it really is.

Ye, eventually once is a year is "instantly" compared to never, you are right xDDD

https://imgur.com/a/KfwOalM#eugT0xy
Ye, for example this guy would have been really hard to catch ;) Also i've seen a Nunu with 100+ games winning less than 5 of those, not getting punished, so ye, tell us more how hard it is, and how they care about it ;)

> [{quoted}](name=Ph03n1xb1rd,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=k9ZcjFlU,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2018-07-31T11:36:24.189+0000)
>
> Ye, eventually once is a year is "instantly" compared to never, you are right xDDD
> 
> https://imgur.com/a/KfwOalM#eugT0xy
> Ye, for example this guy would have been really hard to catch ;) Also i've seen a Nunu with 100+ games winning less than 5 of those, not getting punished, so ye, tell us more how hard it is, and how they care about it ;)

That is not inting, that's soft afk, which is a totally different bag of worms.

Unless you believe dying 0 times and literally don't play the match can still be classified as inting by default, which in that case you're insane.

Yes, this is not inting, this is simply trolling. Ruining the game the same way, and not gettin' detected. If you want to talk about only 6 tear mid rundowns, then i might say, the system can detect THAT, yet nothing else.

> [{quoted}](name=Ph03n1xb1rd,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=k9ZcjFlU,comment-id=000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-07-31T12:08:17.578+0000)
>
> Yes, this is not inting, this is simply trolling. Ruining the game the same way, and not gettin' detected. If you want to talk about only 6 tear mid rundowns, then i might say, the system can detect THAT, yet nothing else.

Yeah, using clearly subtle approach to dodge the system, then come back and claim the system is not strict enough for not being draconian and ban everything suspicious on sight.

Let me guess, if Riot actually doesn't give a shit and anything automatically leads to a ban with no questions asked, would you then come out and say Riot doesn't care because they don't consider players' circumstances? I bet you would, because that's what the likes of you always do. Remember, the challenge is not the ban hammer part of the ordeal, the challenge exists at the part where Riot considers who to NOT ban; if Riot really just wanted the harshest system available which you seem to desire but not really because fuck knows why, implementing it would be an absolute breeze, because they just equate report = ban and call it a day.

But then again, you're just like those vermin who find increasing contrived ways to dodge laws to their own sickening sense of self gratification in supposedly proving the society wrong and that they don't care, even though it's precisely that the society cares that they don't jail and kill everything out of spite. Even more hilariously, when some really had enough and tighten up the laws, you will then come out crying about "censorship" or whatever buzzwords, even though that was what you'd precisely asked for.

You set it up as a no-winning scenario where you can never lose in the argument, or so you think with your tiny brains. And then you hide in the corner laughing because you made a catch-22 argument. Wow that's so cleaver, do you need me put my hands together and fondle your bum bum as a reward?

Look, you do not really know me, so your assumptions are quiet stupid but whatever. Also i have no idea, why do you think this...

The troll/inter banning system is clearly shit, there are a lot of examples here on boards. My argument is winning, because it is right. If these players would get punished i would have no argument and you would be right. but they are not, or after a lot of games, when they become famous on reddit or wherever with their trolling. I don't need anything from you, since you are just a random player from somewhere in the word, i just wanted to point out that the system which you are sooo defending is shit, and not worth any defense.

You probably never read my posts before but im consistently against the chat punishments and for the troll/inter punishment, i dont change my views too much.

But it's easy to follow, i liked to play this game, trolls ruin this game, i don't like trolls -> they should get punished. At least in my opinion :D

Also if you jump in a no-wining scenario, knowing this is a no-winning scenario, that describes you more :O

> [{quoted}](name=Ph03n1xb1rd,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=k9ZcjFlU,comment-id=00000001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-07-31T12:29:29.815+0000)
>
> Look, you do not really know me, so your assumptions are quiet stupid but whatever. Also i have no idea, why do you think this...
> 
> The troll/inter banning system is clearly shit, there are a lot of examples here on boards. My argument is winning, because it is right. If these players would get punished i would have no argument and you would be right. but they are not, or after a lot of games, when they become famous on reddit or wherever with their trolling. I don't need anything from you, since you are just a random player from somewhere in the word, i just wanted to point out that the system which you are sooo defending is shit, and not worth any defense.
> 
> You probably never read my posts before but im consistently against the chat punishments and for the troll/inter punishment, i dont change my views too much.
> 
> But it's easy to follow, i liked to play this game, trolls ruin this game, i don't like trolls -> they should get punished. At least in my opinion :D
> 
> Also if you jump in a no-wining scenario, knowing this is a no-winning scenario, that describes you more :O

Talking is cheap. You refuse to look at any nuanced aspects of the punishment system.

Much like the aim bot NPC in CoD's veteran difficulty is vastly easier to code than their lower difficulty options, a reasonable system is vastly harder to code than a draconian system.

Aim-bots are vastly easier to code, because human-like bots needed to be coded simulated reaction times, human-like reflex, human-like aiming skill, simulated human-like decision making, realistic depths of perception, etc etc etc, whereas aim-bots don't need any of that and it's just a spinning laser tag. 

Similarly, a draconian system will have a very high success rate in banning trolls and whatever, and is VERY easy to code, but it would also have an equally high failure rate because it would falsely ban just as much. A reasonable system on the other hand, will not be anywhere as efficient in weeding out the guilty suspects, but the overall success rate is much higher due to the eliminated amount of false bans.

The challenge is not banning, but pardoning. It's precisely because the system is designed to try and accurately narrow down someone to be absolutely guilty before taking action, that makes grey areas very hard to touch. A person intentionally feeding can end up having the exact same play pattern and score as someone having a bad day and playing absolutely shite; the same goes for other "passive" form of trolling/griefing. Unless there are psychic working at Riot who can directly read the minds of players, they often will NOT be distinguishable to an observer sometimes in the long-term **much like how without any other external procedures and evidences, most police would find most criminals to be no different to everyday people just from observing their public activities. But that is the kind of restraint Riot is restricted to, and there is a fundamental limit on how much it can achieve.**

You don't just go "ban trolls, or you're bad". That's the kind of demand your stupid and clearly uneducated boss would make to their technical experts who actually know and do the damn thing; they don't understand how anything is made and how any system developments work, they just think "if it's not exactly what I wanted AND perfect, it's bad". Do you want to be that guy?

The current system is not "not perfect", it's just total shit.

And false positives did not really bother Rito in chat punishments, just like 2 days ago was a false chat ban because someone was baited to say "kys" without directing at anybody or knowing the meaning. So ye, there might be SOME fake positives, happens, write to support, problem solved. Also the punishment should not be very harsh at start (just to solve the fake positive problem), if you have a bad day and you suck and get falsely caught in the punishment system, go play PvE until you win 3 games, it makes you chill and maybe play your next game better. If "you have a bad day" CONSISTENTLY, you can reach the permanent bans. Also, if they suck at detection, they could rely more on player reports. We always hear that flamers are punished because the community wants so, but they dont give a shit when players (the community) report someone for trolling.

So there are a lot of ways to improve this, yet they are just saying: "It'S hArD tO dEtEcT" and do fckin nothing. If there is anybody at Rito working on this, i would bet he or she is masturbating 90% of his time (or is just simply incompetent for the job).

You seem to think you could do it better. So build a proof of concept. Generate or acquire game logs with the names removed. Write code to parse events and identify trolling behavior. Make sure to test it thoroughly for false positives too.

Go on buddy, even if you don't know programming, python3 isn't that hard to learn.

Yes, obviously I would spend my time fetching data, and building this system for FREE?

Do not make me laugh....

Do not make you laugh?

You sit yourself on a pedestal, acting like you're so high and mighty and above everything, yet you got yourself banned by contributing to the problem of toxicity in games. You're in no position to be acting superior to anybody, Riot least of all.

Proof of concept is not the whole system. It is just the ideation step. Not even to the point of full on development yet.

You're supposed to oversimplify and cut out parts of it so that you don't have to develop the whole thing, that way it's not a waste if nobody bites the hook and approves of the idea.

If it works then Riot might pick it up and develop it, you wouldn't have to do anything else. And as far as payment goes, if you care so much about catching trolls then you should be willing to do such a small task to accomplish such a goal. And if you aren't willing to do that much, then maybe you should stop acting like an armchair developer.

> [{quoted}](name=Ph03n1xb1rd,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=k9ZcjFlU,comment-id=00000001000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-08-01T08:36:35.634+0000)

And i'm totally not willing to do anything for it, because it's pointless, just a waste of my time.

I already explained, for a proof of concept you don't need all that data. League is an event based game, just make up some files with a series of events, you can even automate it with python so it generates more possible files. The point is to prove that you can find trolling by measuring events, not to prove how you can gather data from replay files.

Look, since I do NOT know which games are reported (only Rito knows), I do not have the capacity to download thousands of replays nor to check those if it was really trolling(every system needs check, if you don't have enough sure positives checked by humans it's impossible to test..), I do not know how the replays are formatted, etc etc…

I don't know who you are, but looks like you have no idea how to develop something like this. It's not as easy as you think, at least without the necessary resources....

I've never seen Rito to pick any idea from the players. A lot of players were asking for a "self-mute" (not turnable off midgame), which should be very easy to add, and there is no option for that. And i'm totally not willing to do anything for it, because it's pointless, just a waste of my time.

And i'm totally not willing to do anything for it, because it's pointless, just a waste of my time.

I already explained, for a proof of concept you don't need all that data. League is an event based game, just make up some files with a series of events, you can even automate it with python so it generates more possible files. The point is to prove that you can find trolling by measuring events, not to prove how you can gather data from replay files.

Nice ad hominem, trying to call into question if I know what I'm talking about. I know more than you, so don't start that discrediting bullshit.

Is it as pointless as being an armchair developer? I think not.

LooL, okay since you are an expert in this: 

-" just make up some files with a series of events" - THIS IS why I need the format how the replays are stored, so I can make these files. I can not generate this from scratch.... (Or you think I should just randomly generate a "replay"? Or should I code a bot which plays LoL, man, you are expecting more and more...)
-"you can even automate it with python so it generates more possible files" - Why specifying the language, what more files do I need except the series of events occurred in the game? :O 
-"The point is to prove that you can find trolling by measuring events, not to prove how you can gather data from replay files." - TO HAVE THAT FCKIN SERIES OF EVENTS I need to convert the replay file....


"Nice ad hominem, trying to call into question if I know what I'm talking about. I know more than you, so don't start that discrediting bullshit." - I questioned you, because you looked like "hurr durr, it's soo easy to do, do it for free"

That's it silly, it's just the files that are logs of events.

Example file, for a snippet of early game: (In addition to these events, include chat log and timestamps for both chat and events, some chat is included here but only in a couple places).

Player 1 - 
walked top lane
encountered enemy 3 in field of vision
walked towards enemy 3
used ability 2 on enemy 3
auto attacked enemy 3
auto attacked enemy 3
enemy 3 used ability 1 on player 1
walked towards ally top tower _(perhaps running away?)_
died to enemy 3 and minions
respawned
bought <insert items here>
walked top lane
encountered enemy in field of vision
walked towards minions
auto attacked minion
auto attacked minion
enemy 3 used ability 1 on player 1
player 1 auto attacked minion
enemy 3 auto attacked player 1
player 1 ran towards enemy top tower
_(notice an absence of actions by player 1 against enemy 3 at this point?)_
died to player 3, minions, and top tower
respawned
(spends significant time in fountain, while chatting)
player 1 walked mid lane
encountered enemy 2 in field of vision
used ability 2 on enemy 2
moved towards mid tower
died to enemy 2, minions and mid tower
respawned
walked towards ally blue buff / ally jungler
auto attacked blue buff
auto attacked blue buff
<ally jungler chat saying to leave>
used ability 2 on blue buff
used ability 3 on blue buff
won blue buff
walked towards enemy top tower
encountered enemy 3 in field of vision
enemy 3 

That was fairly simple to set up, and while it's not perfect, it's enough to get the idea across.

To generate a few files like this one you can write some scripts to spit out text lines which follow patterns that approximate actual gameplay, add some variation then you can get a quick sample of events.

The idea isn't to harvest data from replays, let Riot figure out how to do that. The idea is just to prove that code can be written that will parse the events that occur in-game in addition to the chat.

Now you can write code to look for events or patterns of events that could approximate feeding. Give it some easy cases, and see how it does. That is proof of concept. No data harvesting, no complicated analysis, just a few scripts and simple cases to show it can be done.

Stop strawmanning by coming up with ridiculous shit and claiming I expect you to do them. That's bullshit and you know it. Now you're just looking for excuses so you can dismiss me and go back to sitting in your chair telling Riot how to run their game.

Basically you want me to write a bot that plays LoL then.... If I can generate something like this which looks like ACTUAL gameplay, then you basically ask me to write a bot which plays LoL.

Then I also need to do some cases which trolls, which plays good, which plays bad. So you want me to write a bot for every player type (troll, bad, good). Also, these events kind of suck, since with these I have to simulate the game too.

"Walks towards enemy" - I have to know where the enemy is, where I am, my movement speed, obstacles in the way etc etc… I need exact positions, which I can get by simulating a game. So in this current case you are expecting me to write a LoL, which plays itself... What will be the next, should I write an OS too or what more do you want?



Just one more question, did the player in "your" example troll, play bad or be good? (Since I should validate my process on real cases).

> [{quoted}](name=Ph03n1xb1rd,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=k9ZcjFlU,comment-id=00000001000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-08-01T17:28:57.690+0000)
>
> Basically you want me to write a bot that plays LoL then.... If I can generate something like this which looks like ACTUAL gameplay, then you basically ask me to write a bot which plays LoL.

Nope, not at all. You don't need the game data, you don't need position etc. Just events. More on this later.

> Then I also need to do some cases which trolls, which plays good, which plays bad. So you want me to write a bot for every player type (troll, bad, good). Also, these events kind of suck, since with these I have to simulate the game too.
> 
> "Walks towards enemy" - I have to know where the enemy is, where I am, my movement speed, obstacles in the way etc etc… I need exact positions, which I can get by simulating a game. So in this current case you are expecting me to write a LoL, which plays itself... What will be the next, should I write an OS too or what more do you want?

No smartass. You don't need to know any of that. To prove that your program can catch trolling behavior, you just need sample events. Nothing like simulating the actual game nor actual position data or anything else like that. It's the events that matter.

> Just one more question, did the player in "your" example troll, play bad or be good? (Since I should validate my process on real cases).

It was an incomplete example because there wasn't chat, but that would be a troll. They died to their lane opponent twice, then decided to int mid and then steal the jungler's blue buff to deliver to the enemy top laner.

Starting to walk to an enemy with low HP could indicate trolling behaviour, YET if there is a healer in healing range, or Soraka has ultimate, or the healer is walking in the same direction from the same distance it can be a good call...

And even if I don't care about these VERY IMPORTANT DETAILS, you can NOT generate these events without writing a bot, which is waaay to advanced. Or you can try it, write a script wich generates this for ONE player, and try it in a ranked game, lets see how it performs ;)

Do you not understand what PROOF OF CONCEPT means? It's about showing that in basic cases it's possible. That doesn't require covering in-depth event patterns like setting up plays for teammates.

I already explained that you don't need a bot / script that can play the game.

At this point you're just shamelessly straw-manning.

You can NOT write a script which generates these events even resembling the gameplay.

Does it make sense to test this on a game which is NOT LoL, and we do not even know the rules of that game nor anything?

Lets see, my script generates:

Player 1 autoattacks player2
player 2 dies.

WOW, this player1 is the god player of LoL, he 1 hitted the enemy. Can this happen in LoL, nope. Do you have to simulate the healths and damages and ability CDs to make even the simplest fight simulatable, YES. What you generate with this is not LoL, its a game, where you have objects called the same as in Lol, but the rules and everything are not from LoL.

Or lets write another example:

Player 1 pentakill: game won.
Wow, this is a great player....

Another one,
Player 1 takes baron, takes elder, blue and red buffs, dies in enemy fountain. This player trolls.

Nice simulated gameplays man ;)

More shitty strawmen attacks. You don't win an argument by setting up fake targets and knocking them down.

None of those are representative of my position or opinion, yet you pretend that they are mine, just so that you can act like you're superior to me for pointing out how stupid they are. You came up with those ideas, not me.

Stop this. I've played relatively nice up until this point. I won't be so nice if you act like an asshole to me.
I already explained that for proof of concept you don't have to get that complicated.

I'm just saying, that you are unable to write a code which generates a series of events what resembles a real game, without simulating the game. If you are sure, you can, go on and test your firsts thing, and see, it will not happen.


Go in a ranked game and try to reproduce those steps. You simply can NOT do that. This game is simply more complicated than you show in your example.

wow...... your name speaks for itself.

I don't want to assume a position of the judge, or any role.

but you are just rant about when you flamed a inter/troll and decided to take your anger out on posts that don't relate.
The inter detection system is simply shit. Why are you even defending it?
I never claimed it was good, but there are more people whom misunderstand inting than real inters.

I think you should say "There are more players not agreeing with me on the inter/troll definition than real inters(in my definition)."

Then i could agree with you, because it looks like only 6 tear rundown mid is trolling for you :\

There aren't that many inters. True inting happens maybe like ... once every 150 games or so for me. But I see a whole lot more of report calling for inting when the dude was just bad. That happens maybe 1 in 4 or 5 games?

Sure, I can improve on the definitions, but you get what I mean. People are blaming the system when they misunderstand what true inting really is.

No, trolling is waaay more usual than 1 in every 150. What you talk about is the pure hard inting, that might be 1 in every 150.

Yes, i get that the hard inters are very very rare, and they can get punished. But i'm talking about soft inting which goes unpunished and is waay more usual.

Ya, soft trolling and soft inting is indeed the hardest form of disruptive behavior to detect. If they do it well, it'll even be hard for the human eye to distinguish that behavior. 

But isn't soft inting also frequently confused with just bad plays and bad skills?

You should not see bad skills in ranked, skill is always compared to something else, if in your ranked game somebody has "bad skills" that means, he should not be there (boosted/troll). 1-2 bad play in a game does not make you a troll, nobody ever said this (except if it is running down mid 2 times or something like that).

So nah, i don't think it's "frequently" confused, rarely maybe.

When I play Zyra support, I play at a silver1/2 level. If I'm playing any other support, I'm maybe a silver4/5. If I play a laner, I'm probably bronze 1. If I play a jungler, I'm probably bronze3. 

I'm in Silver5 right now and being matched against silver3/4/5 players. But my true MMR is silver 2 with Zyra. All my opponents have bad skill against my Zyra. 

There's also a factor that an opponent in a lane can be the best on their team while up against the worst player on your team. 

If this was a 1v1 match with no external factors, then you can tweak Match Making to have "no bad skill players". But this is a 5v5 match. Even if both teams have the same combined MMR, it doesn't mean that everyone will have the same skill level.

The MM should reduce the std of the team MMR too. Also being in a given division / having a given MMR does not always match, you can play against a low gold, who is simply shit because sinking back from his boosted account or whatever. We do not know the MMRs, so making assumptions about that is not very viable.

Why are you silver 5 if your zarya is "soo good"? Maybe it isn't? And if you are outmatched on your lane, because of a slightly better enemy, you can always go turtle mode and play defensive, losing some farm instead of feeding.

1. I don't play enough to climb.

2. I get bored easily. Especially when I'm just playing 1 champ.

3. I'm always trying to get hextech chests. Meaning I'm either not bringing my best to ranked games, or I'm using my time to play non-ranked games so I can get my hextech chests.

I'm a support main, so my success in lane is largely dependant on how good my partner is. At my ELO, people just know how to shove and don't understand wave management. So the position of the wave really isn't under my control. 




On the topic of bad match making, hopefully the 2019 ranked system will take care of some of the MMR discrepancies.  Especially when it comes to people trying out new roles or autofilled players.


Even if the MMR match making is perfect, it still can't factor for people whom aren't 100% focused for that period of time. Which we are human, we make mistakes, tilt and then make more of the same mistakes multiple times or more serious ones before we refocus and play better.
Maybe its just an EUW thing, because in over 1000 games in league, I've only had 5 or so people who actually intentionally fed...
Good for you! :D

> [{quoted}](name=Kei143,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=k9ZcjFlU,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-07-31T10:58:51.712+0000)
>
> There are two explainations for what you are experiencing:
> 
> 1. Inting detection  is currently tuned to the cautious side to prevent accidentally punishing innocent people.
> 
> 2. You have the incorrect idea of what inting is and are making false reports.
> 
> Since you said you reported so many of them, and inting doesnt happen that often, I'm more geared towards you having an incorrect perception of what inting is.

Inting process also takes longer time, because especially if first report it would need to build up a behaviour history for investigation purposes iirc, which takes time, unlike verbal abuse report which can be processed and finished almost as soon as the report is sent because it's just a bot speed-reading through the chat log and hand out a verdict most of the time.

Trolls and inters do get banned but because they're getting smarter about how they avoid detection (and because Riot wants to try to avoid punishing innocent players as much as possible) it's harder to catch them in the act compared to simple chat-related offenses. Gameplay related offenses when proven to be on purpose are assigned a 2-week ban as the first punishment. In case you don’t believe me on this point [here]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/KHAL90oW-stuck-at-honor-zero?comment=0003) [are]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/E4LnThmW-most-ridiculous-chat-restriction-i-have-ever-seen-in-my-life?comment=0011) [a](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/3jEVVlsY-permanently-banned-with-ingame-log?comment=003e) [couple]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/jFwTE8Oj-playing-off-meta-in-ranked-int-feeding-ban?comment=0039) [examples](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/sU5wOfFJ-proof-that-the-automated-system-is-broken?show=rundown) [of](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/GrmPK5yP-intentional-feeding-but-i-didnt-feed?comment=0006) [gameplay](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/MKBQUoKd-banned-for-intentionally-feeding) trolls being banned. Yes it’s just a few examples, but it proves that they do get punished.

Youmuus once got banned for ending a game 3/18/2.
He won that game.
The deaths were doing to him perma splitpushing and dying of the consequence of getting caught because of that.
He was like top 2 or 3 in that games in terms of gold and took 4 or 5 of the 10 turrets his team has taken down in the end.
Now obviously this cannot be called intentional feeding and the ban was lifted a little down the river, but games like these are the reason riot cannot just ban anyone who has a outrages score in one game.
It'S hArD tO cAtCh ThEm.
